results.title: Burma victory
results.creator_credit: Roy Boulting, David Macdonald and Army Film Unit
results.brief_description: Compilation of footage covering the Burma campaign against the Japanese between 1942 and 1945. For censorship reasons this campaign was given very little newsreel coverage and the footage was assembled into an absorbing narrative. Footage taken by British, Indian and American Combat Cameramen of South-East Asia Command.

results.title: The Boy Kumasenu
results.creator_credit: Sean Graham, John Hollingsworth and Gold Coast Film Unit
results.brief_description: Dramatised documentary of a young African boy, Kumasenu, making his way unaided from the tribal world into the twentieth century. He has known no life other than that of a quiet fishing village. Wrongly accused of bringing bad luck to his people he becomes an outcast and an easy prey to the temptations of the city life of which his flash friend Agboh thinks so highly. Until helped by new friends, life for him is bewildering and dangerous.

results.title: The Battle of Russia
results.creator_credit: Anatole Litvak, Frank Capra and United States. Office of War Information. Overseas Operations Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Why we fight”.
This epic film unfolds the great history of Russia, and the defeat of Hitler’s Nazi armies. The depiction of the mightiest battle in war history, with a human life toll of 20 million Russians and 10 million Germans, becomes more than a first hand record of war; it is also an ode to a people’s courage and self sacrifice, and the end of Hitler’s “Mein Kampf”. Historic film sequences of “The Seige of Leningrad” features the miracle of a “frozen lake” which becomes a rescue highway for a city surrounded and doomed, an event which turned the tide of World War II.

results.title: Exhibition formally known as Synthetics (EFKS)
results.brief_description: An exhibition that charts the history of the electronically generated image in Australia from 1969 - 1988 (roughly). Includes case studies by artists whose creative innovations have influenced significantly the evolution of electronic media arts. (see: Documentation for details)
results.description: An exhibition that charts the history of the electronically generated image in Australia from 1969 - 1988 (roughly). results.title: Synthetics. Volume 4
results.brief_description: Volume 4 of a 4 volume CD-ROM collection of material compiled by Stephen Jones for the exhibition formally known as Synthetics. Content is arranged in folders and as a collection of texts, images and hypertexts. The main folder contains material relating to the work of Stephen Jones. (see: Documentation for details)

results.title: Synthetics. Volume 2
results.brief_description: Volume 2 of a 4 volume CD-ROM collection of material compiled by Stephen Jones for the exhibition formally known as Synthetics. Content is arranged in folders and as a collection of texts, images and hypertexts. The folders contain material relating to the work of the following artists: Andrew Quinn, Ariel, David Chesworth, Doug Richardson, Iain MacLeod, Jeff Seidler, Jill Scott, Jon McCormack, Peter Callas, Sally Pryor, Tom Ellard and Wendy Spencer. (see: Documentation for details)
